text: Martin Pierre Brodeur (born May 6, 1972, in Montreal, Quebec) is a Canadian professional ice hockey goaltender. He was formerly a ice hockey goaltender for the New Jersey Devils in the National Hockey League (NHL) and ins currently a current team executive for the New Jersey Devils. During his 21-years with the Devils, he was a three-time Stanley Cup champion and holds more than thirty Devils team records. On June 7, 2014, Brodeur told ESPN that he would test the free agency market for the 2014-15 season. == Awards == * Calder Memorial Trophy — 1994 * NHL 1st All-Star Team — 2003, 2004, 2007 * NHL 2nd All-Star Team — 1997, 1998, 2006, 2008 * NHL All-Rookie Team — 1994 * NHL All-Star Game — 1996, 1997, 1998, 1999, 2000, 2001, 2003, 2004, 2007, 2008 * Olympic Gold Medal — 2002, 2010 * Primus World'Stars Challenge Bowl — 2004 * QMJHL 2nd All-Star Team — 1992 * QMJHL All-Rookie Team — 1990 * Stanley Cup — 1995, 2000, 2003 * Vezina Trophy — 2003, 2004, 2007, 2008 * William M. Jennings Trophy — 1997 (with Mike Dunham), 1998, 2003 (tied Roman Čechmánek & Robert Esche), 2004, 2010 Tied most all time with Patrick Roy * World Cup of Hockey Championship — 2004 == References == == Other websites == *Official website * * Category:1972 births Category:Calder Trophy winners Category:Canadian ice hockey goaltenders Category:Olympic gold medalists for Canada Category:Ice hockey people from Quebec Category:Living people Category:New Jersey Devils players Category:Sportspeople from Montreal Category:Stanley Cup champions Category:Utica Devils players Category:Vezina Trophy winners Category:Quebec Major Junior Hockey League players
title: Martin Brodeur
